Package makesudokus.logic

Class SudokuController

  • java.lang.Object
    • makesudokus.logic.SudokuController
  • public class SudokuController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as the main controller for the application logic. It contains the sudoku, passes data to the GUI and invokes the solving algorithms.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SudokuController()
      Constructor, initializes a sudoku and the solver classes.

    • Method Detail

      • getSudoku

        public int[][] getSudoku()
        An API method for the GUI.
        Returns:
        Returns the sudoku's contents.

      • updateNumber

        public boolean updateNumber​(int x,
                            int y,
                            int newNumber)
        An API method for the GUI. Invokes the setNumber(int x, int y, int newNumber) of the Sudoku object.
        Parameters:
        x - x axis coordinate.
        y - y axis coordinate.
        newNumber - New number to be placed in the slot.
        Returns:
        Returns true for successful operation and false for unsuccessful.

      • getNumber

        public int getNumber​(int x,
                     int y)
        Fetches the number of a single cell in the Sudoku.
        Parameters:
        x - x axis coordinate of the sudoku.
        y - y axis coordinate of the sudoku.
        Returns:
        Returns the value in the given coordinates.

      • isSolved

        public boolean isSolved()
        Returns:
        Returns the solved state of the sudoku.

      • solveWithBacktracker

        public boolean solveWithBacktracker()
        Calls the backtracker solving algorithm.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the sudoku is solved.

      • solveWithCrook

        public boolean solveWithCrook()
        Calls the solving algorithm based on crook's algorithm
        Returns:
        Currently returns true if the sudoku is solved

      • resetSudoku

        public void resetSudoku()
        Resets the sudoku to what you started with.
